stanza.line: O how I faint when I of you do writewrite
Knowing a better spirit doth use your namename
And in the praise thereof spends all his mightmight
To make me tongue-tied speaking of your famefame
But since your worth (wide as the ocean is)is)
The humble as the proudest sail doth bearbear
My saucy bark (inferior far to his)his)
On your broad main doth wilfully appearappear
Your shallowest help will hold me up afloatafloat
Whilst he upon your soundless deep doth rideride
Or (being wrecked) I am a worthless boatboat
He of tall building and of goodly pridepride
Then if he thrive and I be cast awayaway
The worst was this my love was my decaydecay
